summary.title: Technical Program Manager & Low-Code Expert
summary.overview: Combines strategic leadership of a $70M program with hands-on expertise in Appian, Salesforce, OneStream, Docusign, and Agile methodologies. Specialized in leading digital transformation efforts that modernized legacy DoD systems, resulting in an annual $142k labor cost reduction, a ~$2M profit increase, and significant NPS improvements.

projects.name: Army – Resource Managers Workspace (RMW) & Installation Resource Integration Tool (IRIT)
responsibilities: Leads a team of 20+ across requirements, development, testing, training, and organizational change management (OCM) workstreams in successfully executing the $70M Army RMW and Army G9 IRIT OneStream projects.

Guides government stakeholders in the strategic deployment of a OneStream Planning, Programming, Budgeting, Execution (PPBE) system to the Army Budget Office (ABO), all 26 commands, and 10,000+ users.
Proactively works with Army stakeholders to identify further opportunities and requirements enabling the future divestiture of several legacy systems.
Coaches the Agile team in delivery best practices including Scrum, requirements elicitation, analysis/design, and testing.
Rescued a failing project following a failed Initial Operating Capabilities (IOC) go-live.
Overhauled delivery processes and established transparent client communication, resulting in a Net Promoter Score (NPS) increase from Detractor to Promoter.
Navigated federally mandated budget reductions, minimizing impact to milestones and personnel, and increased profitability by +$2M.

projects.name: National Defense University – NDU Connect/ Academic Business Support
responsibilities: Served as Deputy Project Manager, Scrum Master, Business Analyst, and Docusign Developer.

Configured Salesforce and Docusign functionality, resulting in a savings of 1,450 hours annually, a ~$142,100 labor cost reduction, and an estimated 11% decrease in data entry errors via full digitalization.
Contributed to presentation on “Educating Tomorrow’s Defense Leaders by Enabling AI-readiness through DoD University Data Standardization” at the 2024 Army University Learning Symposium.
Collaborated with stakeholders to identify goals and communicate progress/risks via Power BI dashboards.
Managed Agile documentation efforts via Azure DevOps Boards, Teams, and SharePoint.

projects.name: Air Force Office of Special Investigations – OSI Records, Investigations & Operations Network
responsibilities: Utilized prior experience to inform technical design decisions regarding enforcement case management systems in Appian.
Implemented best practices to reduce system load times by ~30% for high-volume operations.
Improved usability and maintainability by enforcing documentation standards.
Redesigned all user interfaces to better align with Section 508 and WCAG 2.0 standards.

projects.name: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration – Enforcement Case Management System
responsibilities: Built a joint enforcement case management system in Appian for NOAA’s Office of Law Enforcement and General Counsel Section.
Led UI/UX endeavors, including the creation of a UX Design and Style guide.
Designed foundational functionalities, including user management and task management.
Developed process to produce 60+ dynamically generated PDF and Microsoft Word documents via XML templates.
Implemented Record Type functionalities to optimize speed and efficiency.

projects.name: Department of Labor – Trade Adjustment Assistance
responsibilities: Performed O&M for the DOL Trade Adjustment Assistance application by migrating historical data and increasing system performance in Appian.
Reviewed system against requirements to identify gaps and usability issues.
Facilitated backlog grooming sessions and coached the customer on prioritizing new capabilities.
Quickly addressed production defects and corrected in-flight processes.

projects.name: Office of the Comptroller of the Currency – Central Application Tracking
responsibilities: Led teams of 3+ in developing and designing viable Appian solutions for design challenges and contract proposal demos in under one month.
Developed enterprise framework applications for rapid implementation of common application features.
Implemented integrations including Google Cloud Document AI, Google Cloud Vision API, Google Cloud Natural Language API, Google Maps API, Google Chart API, SharePoint, and Salesforce.
Trained junior staff in software engineering best practices and consulting approaches.
Served as a database developer on 3 concurrent projects.

projects.name: Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services – Acquisition Lifecycle Modernization
responsibilities: Designed and implemented BPM-based solutions using Appian low-code software.
Performed analysis, design, and development of BPM-based applications in an Agile environment.
Translated business process system requirement specifications into process model prototypes and solutions.
Researched key systems and wrote business proposals to enhance internal enterprise frameworks.
Presented UX designs and solutions to senior staff, promoting user-centric design decisions.

education.degree: Master of Science (M.S.) IT: Systems Engineering

education.institution: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

activities: Lead presenter at the FIRST Chesapeake GEARED UP: Mentors Conference 2024 on adapting and implementing Agile Scrum methodologies for student-led teams.
Assisted full-time staff with recruiting volunteers and assigning volunteer roles for three-day competitions.
Facilitated age-appropriate education on cybersecurity for students via card games.
Mentored team of 15+ high school students in Agile Scrum methodologies, systems engineering, design principles, and software development.
Supported team in achieving 2023 and 2024 Chesapeake District Championship wins, Innovation in Control Award, Excellence in Engineering Award, and 4 Autonomous Awards.

certifications: MIT xPRO Driving Innovation with Generative AI
awards_and_affiliations: Eagle Scout, Boy Scouts of America
Member, Alpha Phi Omega (National Service Fraternity)
Member, Phi Theta Kappa Honor Society
